intro: Epilobium australe var. andinum, commonly known as the Andean willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine soils. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, pink to red flowers in clusters. It is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other species such as willow herbs and evening primroses. Its botanical characteristics make it well adapted to cold, mountainous climates.
